alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 1:58AM EST until December 20 at 1:24AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. .Significant flooding is ongoing in Guilford and Dover-Foxcroft. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River above Dover-Foxcroft. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding reaches School Street in Guilford and State Route 15 in Dover-Foxcroft. Fast moving water inundates South Street and low lying properties along East Main Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Flooding is Ongoing - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM EST Tuesday was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 4.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.2 feet on 04/28/1979. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 200 PM EST.
